greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Maximal run length of primes of the form n, n+2, n+2*3, n+2*3*5,..
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..100000
maple: A002110 := proc(n) option remember; mul(ithprime(i),i=1..n) ; end proc:
A175663 := proc(n) if isprime(n) then for p from 1 do if not isprime(n+A002110(p)) then return p ; end if; end do: else return 0 ; end if; end proc:
mathematica: Array[If[PrimeQ@ #, Block[{s = {1}}, While[PrimeQ[# + Times @@ Prime@ s], AppendTo[s, s[[-1]] + 1]]; Last@ s], 0] &, 105] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jan 03 2019 *)
program: (PARI) A175663(n) = if(!isprime(n),0,my(pr=2); for(k=1, oo, if(!isprime(pr+n), return(k)); pr *= prime(1+k))); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 03 2019
xref: Cf. A006512 (greater of twin primes), A175612 (list of twin semiprimes), A175648 (lesser of twin semiprimes).
results.author: Vladislav-Stepan Malakovsky & _Juri-Stepan Gerasimov_, Aug 04 2010
